result.execSummary:
The defendant Gavin L Groce was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges by 06-08-16 or, if not paid, civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.

Consecutive to: Any other sentence; Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for WORK. COURT OBJECT TO ES.

COURT OBJECTS TO EXPUNGEMENT ON THIS RECORD

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gavin L Groce

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gavin L Groce in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Justice point report recieved and filed.   Defendant waived rights and pled guilty. 

Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve  ONE MONTH  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply FOR WORK. COURT OBJECTS TO ES. 

Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees  and surcharges by 6-8-16  or, if not paid, civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant. 

Court objects to expungment on this record. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Gavin L Groce in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests an adjournment. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gavin L Groce in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-26-2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice point report received and filed. lr

Defendant Gavin L Groce in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Thornton in earlier, defendant arrived late.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch
 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 04-15-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Gavin L Groce in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Gavin L Groce in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
